instNote: ﻿To this mission are attached New Bedford, Wareham, Sandwich and Nantucket

﻿church not dedicated, This is a new and thriving settlement, on a tract of land purchased four years ago, by Bishop Fenwick, of about twelve thousand acres. It lies in Penobscot co. in township No. 2, fifth range, between the Salmon and Moluncas rivers. The object of this purchase was to induce those among the Irish Catholics, who were desirous of purchasing small farms of from 50 to 100 acres, to settle together, as they could thus be more easily provided with a priest, and enjoy the benefits of their religion. The settlement promises well, and consists at the present time, of about thirty or forty families - and is daily increasing. The soil is of first rate quality, and the situation exceedingly healthy.
